Detailed Description

This struct defines the parameters for scatter correction
Parameters:
enable true/false apply motion correction
modelType "basic", ...
pointSeparation separation between scatter points in mm
pointOffset max distance (mm) to randomly move scatter points
spaceRadius radius (mm) of coarse scatter space
endPointAxialStep Axial sampling (mm) of coarse scatter space
endPointAzimuthalStep Angular smapling (degrees) of coarse scatter space
updateIteration[SCATTER_UPDATE_ARR_LEN] list of iteration numbers to update scatter estimate (format iter:subiter,iter:subiter...)
updateSamplingFactor[SCATTER_UPDATE_ARR_LEN]; list of downsampling scale factors for each scatter update
autoScaling 0=no scaling to outside events, 1=yes
raySumStepSize step size in mm to take in computing line integrals
attenThreshold scatter points are not placed in regions with mu value < this (mm^(-1))
attenScaleParam0 used to scale attenuation factor with formula:
attenScaleParam1 attenScaleFactor = p0 +p1*scatterAngleCosine + p2*POW2(scatterAngleCosine)
attenScaleParam2 formula = 1 for scatter angle of 0, > 1 (i.e., more atten) for angle > 0
reconLLD LLD to use for reconstruction
computeIncidenceAngles boolean flag to scale efficiencies for incident angles
globalScaleFactor scale factor for scatter (only used for simulation or if autoScaling = 0
detectionEffParam0 scale detection efficiency for low-energy photons
detectionEffParam1 p0 + p1*scatterAngleCosine + p2*POW2(scatterAngleCosine)
detectionEffParam2 formula = 1 for scatter angle of 0, >1 (i.e., better stopping) for angle>0
detectionThreshold probability threshold - do not bother including photons with too low prob.
energyResolution FWHM as fraction of true energy
energyBackground probability of detection independent of energy
verbosity level of debugging output
